data.title: Countries that use the Swedish krone
data.meta_description: Usage and exchange rates of the Swedish krone. Convert SEK to any other currency.
data.text:
The Swedish krone was established in 1873 as an official national currency and is used only in Sweden. It replaced the previously valid riksdaler. 1 Krone is devided into 100 Öre.

ISO 4127:

SEK

Numeric:

752

Symbol:

kr

List of all currencies

Overview: Sweden

1.00 Swedish krones = 0.095 US dollars

Currency:

Convert to:

Amount:

↔ Reverse currencies

Exchange rate history 1 SEK in USD

The graph shown here shows the exchange rate development from January 2018 to March 2024. The exchange rate for 1 SEK moved during this time from USD 0.12 to USD 0.10. In these 74 months it fell by 20.0 percent.

› Inflation development in Sweden

Currency reserves for the Swedish krone

According to the International Monetary Fund, the total broad money (M3) amounted to SEK 4.950 trillion at the end of 2023. For currency hedging, reserves were held in a total amount of 645.76 billion krones. This corresponds to a ratio of 1:7.7. In other words, not even 1 of 7 krones is deposited with a countervalue.

Approximately 118.15 billion krones (18.3%) of the currency reserves exist in gold reserves. The remainder consists of foreign currencies, special drawing rights in the International Monetary Fund and other reserve positions.

› Worldwide currency and gold reserves

Sources

All conversion rates are based on data from the European Central Bank.

Data on currency and gold reserves are from the International Monetary Fund.
